Description.Html: Court administrative assistants help with the daily running of courts and their supporting offices.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about careers in the courts and tribunals service from Skills for Justice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress from administrative assistant to administrative officer and then to executive officer or team manager.

Description.Html: Court legal advisers are trained lawyers who advise magistrates and district judges about the law.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: The Bar Council and The Law Society have more information about legal careers and training.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
The legal adviser career structure has 5 levels, known as tiers. On any tier, you could become a mentor. To move up, you'll need to prove your ability in your current role.

With 5 years' experience, you could become a deputy district judge or district judge (magistrates' courts). With more experience, you could become a justices' clerk (running several courts).

You could also apply for legal and non-legal secondments within the wider departments of Her Majesty's Courts and Tribunal Service (HMCTS), the Ministry of Justice and other government agencies.

Another option is to move into private practice as a solicitor or barrister, or join the Crown Prosecution Service as a crown prosecutor or crown advocate.

Description.Html: Court ushers make sure that everyone involved with a court case is present and that they know what to do.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the courts and tribunals service from Skills for Justice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could supervise a team of ushers, or become a court administrative officer.

Description.Html: Crane drivers operate lifting machinery on construction, quarrying and mining sites, at ports and in warehouses.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful if you've got experience as an operative in construction, mechanical engineering or plant operations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about training and working as a crane driver from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a Level 3 or 4 NVQ Diploma in Lifting Operations, you could become a crane supervisor, directing operations.

After further training you may be able to work as a site manager, with responsibility for the day-to-day running of a construction or quarrying site.

Description.Html: Credit controllers help firms get the money they are owed from businesses and individuals.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details on working in credit control, and specialist in-work qualifications, from the Chartered Institute of Credit Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and professional qualifications, you could be promoted to credit manager.

You could also start your own collection agency or set up as a freelance field collection agent.

Description.Html: Credit managers control the amount of finance offered by their company and manage the debts owed to it.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in credit control from the Chartered Institute of Credit Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress into senior management or move to a larger company.

Alternatively, you could move into insolvency work with an accountancy firm or become a self-employed consultant, advising businesses on credit systems.

Description.Html: Crematorium technicians make sure things run smoothly during a cremation.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on crematorium work and training through the Institute of Cemetery and Crematorium Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into crematorium management.

Description.Html: Professional cricketers play for their club or county side in league and cup competitions, and some go on to play at international level.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Professional Cricketers' Association for personal development and support, both during and after your professional career.

HtbCareerTips.Html: County players often combine study or a second job, like coaching, with a playing career. This is because some playing contracts only cover the spring and summer months. Other players join teams in overseas leagues and competitions during the UK winter.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a professional cricketer from the England and Wales Cricket Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into coaching with clubs, schools and colleges. Your experience would also be useful for jobs in community sports development, sports science or sports management.

You might also re-train to become a sports journalist, physiotherapist or PE teacher.

Description.Html: Criminal intelligence analysts use data to detect and prevent crime and protect UK security.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in intelligence from the security agencies:GCHQ; Secret Intelligence Service MI6; Security Service MI5

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work as a senior analyst, giving specialist advice and assessing trends to work with managers on future priorities.

Employers usually offer clear career paths to more senior roles.

You might also move to related areas of work within your organisation, for example applying to become a police officer.

Description.Html: Criminologists look at the reasons why people commit crimes and find ways to reduce re-offending.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Society of Criminology for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in crime and justice from GOV.UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior policy adviser on crime and crime reduction with local or national government, the police or the probation service.

You could also work as a specialist researcher in particular offences, for example online abuse, organised crime or youth offending.

With further training, you might move into social or probation work, a career in law or join the security services.

Description.Html: Critical care technologists (CCTs) make sure equipment used in the care of critically ill patients is safe and effective.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll be employed by an NHS organisation and paid a salary while you train.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about training and working in critical care science and technology from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to lead CCT.

You could move into a specialist field of critical care like liver and transplant work, cardiology, neurophysiology, burns, premature baby units and respiratory physiology.

Description.Html: Croupiers run the games in casinos and make sure the games take place in a fair and friendly manner.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a croupier from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to inspector or pit boss, and then on to manager.

You could also work on a cruise ship or overseas.

Description.Html: Crown prosecutors make sure that decisions to bring people to court are fair and likely to succeed.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about being a crown prosecutor from the Crown Prosecution Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training you could progress to senior crown prosecutor.

From there you could become crown advocate, senior crown advocate and principal crown advocate.

Description.Html: Cruise ship stewards clean and service cabins on board cruise ships.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can get more advice about careers in hospitality and tourism through the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to a supervisor post, like assistant housekeeper.

You could also move into other areas like working as a croupier in the casino, or entertainment or restaurant work.

Description.Html: Customer service assistants deal with customers' queries, purchases and complaints.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or customer services manager.

You could also move into sales or account handling.

Description.Html: Customer services managers develop service standards, deal with customer enquiries and manage customer service teams.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Institute of Customer Service for professional development training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in management through the Chartered Management Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into a more senior position, be responsible for customer service across a region, or become a customer service director for a whole organisation.

Description.Html: Customs officers stop banned items coming in or out of the country, and collect taxes and duties.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move up within the civil service grade structure, but you may need to relocate to progress to higher grades.

Description.Html: Cyber intelligence officers gather information about where threats to information technology (IT) systems come from and how they work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in digital security from the National Cyber Security Centre and Security Service MI5.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a specialised cyber security lead and then head of cyber security.

You could also be a freelance contractor.

Description.Html: Cycle mechanics build, repair and service all kinds of bikes.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a large organisation like British Cycling, who employ specialist mechanics working for the British racing team.

With 3 to 5 years’ experience you could progress to head mechanic.

You could also become self-employed and set up a mobile bike mechanic business, or open your own shop. The Cycling Experts have more information on setting up a bike shop.

As an experienced and qualified cycle mechanic you could also move into teaching other mechanics.

Description.Html: Cycling coaches help riders develop their cycling skills.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a cycling coach and coaching qualifications from British CyclingandCycling UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for British Cycling as a development coach, introducing people to cycling, or working on talent programmes to support cyclists.

You could work as a coach for a local authority or organisation with an interest in sports development at places like BMX tracks, mountain bike trail centres or indoor cycling tracks.

You could become a self-employed coach and design training programmes for amateur riders.

You could also become a cycle trainer through the Bikeability scheme, teaching young people how to cycle safety on roads. If you work with young people, you could move into sports development or youth work.

With experience, you could transfer your skills and abilities to other areas of the sports industry.

Description.Html: Dance movement psychotherapists use dance and movement to help people deal with emotional, psychological and physical issues.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Association for Dance Movement Psychotherapy UK for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in dance movement psychotherapy through the Association for Dance Movement Psychotherapy UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could teach dance movement psychotherapy, or provide clinical supervision to less experienced colleagues.

You could be a consultant, set up in private practice or work on a self-employed, freelance basis.

Description.Html: Dance teachers train and develop their pupils in all types of dance.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can search for jobs in schools through the Teaching Vacancies service.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a dance teacher from:Council for Dance, Drama and Musical Theatre; One Dance UK; Get Into Teaching

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In a school you could become a head of department or headteacher.

You could also move into choreography or dance movement psychotherapy, with further training.

As a private dance teacher you could develop your own business and run your own dance school.

Description.Html: Dancers use movement to perform for live audiences or in recorded performances.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join One Dance UK and Equity for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Classical ballet dancers start training very young, usually at 10 or 11 years old. It's possible to make a career in contemporary dance if you start at a later age, if you're prepared to work hard and put in a lot of training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a dancer from:Creative Choices; One Dance UK; Council for Dance, Drama and Musical Theatre

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into choreography or dance teaching.

Description.Html: Data analyst-statisticians identify trends, create models, collect numerical information and present results.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some employers will expect you to have a working knowledge of statistical software packages, like Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS).

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more on careers in statistics from the Royal Statistical Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress into management, move into academic research or work as a freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Data entry clerks type information into databases and systems and create letters, reports and other documents.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You would normally be tested for keyboard skills and accuracy in entering data when you go for an interview.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about careers in IT from The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or team leader. You could also train and mentor new employees.

Description.Html: Database administrators (DBAs) plan and build computer systems, and make sure they’re secure and working properly.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in IT support, programming or web development will help.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: Tech Future Careers and the Chartered Institute for IT have more details about careers and training in computing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into IT project management or systems analysis, web development or network management.

You could also become self-employed, or move into consultancy.

Description.Html: Delivery van drivers collect a wide range of items and deliver them to customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Having experience in storage or warehousing could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in parcel delivery from the Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could complete training for a large goods vehicle (LGV) licence for opportunities in freight transport and tanker driving.

If you take specialist training, like defensive driving and personal security, you could drive vehicles containing cash and valuable items. You'd also usually need a Security Industry Association (SIA) licence for this.

Description.Html: Demolition operatives dismantle buildings and structures, remove hazardous materials, and carry out salvage operations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in demolition from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With further training, you could specialise in a particular demolition method, like explosives.

With experience you could progress into site supervision and management.

Description.Html: Dental hygienists offer advice, information and treatments to prevent and treat tooth decay and gum disease.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about dental hygiene careers from the British Society of Dental Hygiene & Therapy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into dental practice management.

With further training you could teach student dental hygienists.

You could also move into a related area like orthodontic therapy or health promotion.

Description.Html: Dental nurses help dentists to treat their patients and do reception work and other tasks in the practice.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The British Association of Dental Nurses for professional development training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about dental nursing from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you may be able to move into jobs like team manager, team leader or dental practice manager.

With further training you could become a dental therapist, helping a dentist carry out the more routine dentistry work. You could also become a dental hygienist, helping people to look after their teeth and gums.

You might decide to train as an orthodontic therapist helping dentists to improve the look and position of a patient's teeth.

Health Careers has information on careers in all areas of the dental team.

Description.Html: Dental technicians design, make and repair the dental appliances used for improving patients' appearance, speech or ability to eat.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Dental Technologists Association, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about how to become a dental technician from Health Careers.

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could train as a healthcare scientist, specialising in reconstructive sciences, like maxillo-facial prosthetics through the NHS Scientist Training Programme (STP).

With experience you could set up your own laboratory, or work abroad.

In a commercial lab, you could become a senior or chief technician. Or you could move into quality control, sales or management. You could also become a teacher.

Description.Html: Dentists diagnose and treat teeth and mouth problems, and work to prevent dental disease and promote oral health.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a dentist from the British Dental Association and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a dentist in general practice you could go on to become a partner in the practice or set up your own practice.

If you're working in the hospital dental service, you'll be able to follow the same career structure and training pathway as a hospital doctor. You could also specialise, for example in implant or paediatric dentistry.

As a consultant, you'll often find work opportunities in the private sector.

With experience, you could lead a team, or manage a unit or department.

You could also progress to teaching and training students, trainee dentists and other healthcare professionals.

Description.Html: Dietitians diagnose and treat people with nutrition problems, and help people make healthy lifestyle and dietary decisions.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the British Dietetic Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about becoming a dietitian from the British Dietetic Association and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a team leader or department manager.

You could also become self-employed.

You might take further training to use your skills in education, manufacturing, research, journalism, marketing, advertising or public relations.

Description.Html: Digital marketers promote brands, products and services through social media, websites and apps.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about careers and training in digital marketing from The Chartered Institute of Marketing and The Institute of Direct and Digital Marketing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular type of digital marketing like mobile or video marketing.

You could progress to senior digital marketing officer or head of online marketing. You could also become a freelance digital marketing consultant, or move into a related area like advertising, sales or public relations.

Description.Html: Digital product owners lead a team of specialists to build web products and services.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the digital industry from Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could apply for a more senior role like head of product or senior product manager.

You could also move into general senior management positions.

Some product managers become self-employed.

Description.Html: Diplomatic service officers help to promote and protect British interests, businesses and citizens overseas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the diplomatic service through the Foreign and Commonwealth Office and Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll have access to a wide range of Civil Service training, designed to prepare you for your first overseas posting. This includes foreign language training.

You'll be encouraged to identify your own training needs as part of an appraisal and staff development programme.

After 2 years, you can apply to join the Fast Stream programme if your manager thinks you have the potential for senior management.

Description.Html: Directors of photography (DoPs) manage lighting and camera crews on TV and film productions to create the right look and feel for images.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join an organisation like the British Society of Cinematographers for industry news and latest developments in camera techniques and technology.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working as a director of photography from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could work on TV and film productions with bigger budgets, or become a director or producer.

Description.Html: Dispensing opticians give advice on vision care, and supply glasses and contact lenses to suit their customers needs. uniquefilter

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association of British Dispensing Opticians, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a dispensing optician from theAssociation of British Dispensing Opticians and the General Optical Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become assistant manager or self-employed.

You could work as a consultant to a lens manufacturer or as a sales representative, selling ophthalmological instruments. You could also work in a hospital or in university teaching.

With further training, you could go on to qualify and work as an optometrist.

Description.Html: District nurses care for people outside of hospital in patients' homes, GP surgeries and residential care homes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about how to become a district nurse from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could lead a team of nurses or become a community matron. You could also go into general health service management or become head of community nursing.

You could move into health promotion, research or education. You may also be able to find work overseas, especially in developing countries.

Description.Html: Divers work underwater at sea, or in rivers, lakes, canals and reservoirs.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You might find it useful to have experience of recreational scuba diving before training as a commercial diver.

Many diving schools offer tests to help you decide whether you'll be suited to working underwater.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about commercial and leisure diving careers through the:Health and Safety Executive; International Marine Underwater Contractors Association; Professional Association of Diving Instructors; British Sub-Aqua Club

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You’d normally be self-employed as a commercial diver.

With experience and further training, you could move into roles with extra responsibility and more pay, like life support technician or diving supervisor.

If working in a dive centre you could move into a management role.

You could also set up a business, or work in a related field where diving skills are necessary, like swimming pool engineering or maintenance.

Description.Html: DJs play music for audiences in live venues, at events or on the radio.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Do your research and make sure that your demo mixes fit in with a venue's music policy or the type of music on a radio station's playlist.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about becoming a DJ from:Creative Choices; Community Media Association; Hospital Broadcasting Association; Radio Academy

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a successful club DJ, you could move into music producing and recording, club promoting, working for a record label or starting your own label.

As an established radio DJ, you could get involved in other types of media work, like TV presenting.

Description.Html: Dog groomers keep dogs' coats in good condition, and give their owners advice on coat care, grooming and diet.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a dog groomer from the Pet Industry Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and qualifications, you could become self-employed and work from home or become a mobile groomer, visiting owners' homes.

You could also open your own salon or move into training.

Description.Html: Dog handlers work with specially trained dogs to help detect and prevent crime, find lost or missing people and protect property.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a dog handler from the College of Animal Welfare.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Promotion opportunities will depend on the service or organisation that you work for. In the police and armed forces, you may have to move out of dog handling to get promoted to the higher ranks.

In security, you could go on to be head of canine services, where you direct teams of dog handlers.

You might also become a trainer, working with organisations like search and rescue, to help train dogs and their handlers.

Description.Html: Domestic appliance service engineers install and repair household goods like washing machines and fridges.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Domestic Appliance Service Association for product news and industry training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in engineering repair and maintenance through Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management, regional services coordination, technical sales or training.

You could also set up your own business.

Description.Html: Domestic energy assessors (DEAs) work out the energy efficiency of domestic buildings like houses and flats.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With further training, you could carry out assessments on non-domestic (commercial) buildings, or move into assessor training.

Description.Html: Door supervisors enforce the entry policy in venues like pubs, bars and nightclubs and look after the safety of the people inside.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the International Professional Security Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
If you already hold a door supervision qualification gained in the last 3 years, you may be able to apply for a front line licence. Check the information about previous qualifications from the Security Industry Authority.

As a door supervisor, you'll need to renew your licence every 3 years.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or area supervisor.

You could move into other types of security-related work, like retail security.

You could also go on to set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Dramatherapists use group work, role play and movement to help people with their feelings and emotions.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Association of Dramatherapists for professional recognition and training and development opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may help if you've got a background in teaching, acting, nursing or social work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find advice about how to become a dramatherapist from the British Association of Dramatherapists and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior or consultant dramatherapist and lead a team of therapists or manage a unit.

You could also train other dramatherapists or set up your own practice.

Description.Html: Dressmakers create made-to-measure clothing like dresses, trousers and blouses for their customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in art and design can help you get into this job.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could take on a supervisory role, move into a related career like fashion or textile buying, or become self-employed.

You could also work in costume production for theatre, TV and film.

Description.Html: Driving instructors teach people the skills and knowledge they need to drive safely and pass their driving test.

HtbBodies.Html: It may help your career if you join a driving instructor association.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a driving instructor from GOV.UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training you could move into specialist areas like training disabled drivers. You might also train drivers of passenger carrying vehicles, large goods vehicles (LGV) or emergency services vehicles.

GOV.UK has information on professional development and if you're highly experienced, you could become a driving examiner.

Description.Html: Drug and alcohol workers help people tackle their drug, alcohol or solvent misuse problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a drug and alcohol worker from Turning Point.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a volunteer coordinator, project team leader or service manager.

Description.Html: Dry cleaners use chemicals and solvents to clean clothes and other items that can't be washed in the normal way.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Retail sales experience could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in laundry and dry cleaning services through the Guild of Cleaners and Launderers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In a dry-cleaning plant you could progress to supervisor or manager.

In a dry cleaning shop, you could be promoted to store manager. If your shop is part of a chain you may be able to progress to running a larger shop, or to area or district management.

Description.Html: Dry liners use plasterboard panels to build internal walls, suspended ceilings and raised flooring in houses, offices and shops.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training in dry lining through Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a site supervisor, estimator or dry lining quantity surveyor.

You could also set up your own dry lining business.

Description.Html: Early years teachers are specialists in early childhood development and work with children up to the age of 5.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can search for jobs in schools through the Teaching Vacancies service.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about teaching in early years from Get Into Teaching.

You can also get details through CACHE and the early years career progression map.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Once qualified, you could move into management of a nursery or group of nurseries.

You could also work as a supply teacher or take further training to become a primary school teacher or play therapist.

Description.Html: Ecologists study the relationship between plants, animals and the environment.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the British Ecological Society, which offers mentoring from experienced ecologists, research news, and education and job search support.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers in ecology through the British Ecological Society and the Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could apply for Chartered Environmentalist (CEnv) or Chartered Ecologist (CEcol) status.

You could then progress to senior ecologist, leading a team of researchers, developing biodiversity plans or acting as a consultant on sustainable development projects.

Description.Html: E-commerce managers manage the sale and promotion of products and services on the internet.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in e-commerce from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into senior management roles like sales director and chief executive, or set up your own business as an e-commerce consultant.

Description.Html: Economic development officers work with communities, local government and business to bring investment, jobs and facilities to an area.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can learn more about working in economic development through the Institute of Economic Development.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior officer or economic policy manager.

You could also move into freelance consultancy work, or work abroad with international development agencies.

Description.Html: Economists advise government departments, businesses, banks and other organisations about the economy.

HtbBodies.Html: You can find professional development training and networking opportunities with the Royal Economic Society and the The Society of Professional Economists.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working as an economist in the public sector through the Government Economic Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior levels or become a self-employed freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Editorial assistants provide support at all stages of the publication process for books, journals, magazines and online content.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the The Publishers Association and Professional Publishers Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an editorial assistant from:The Publishers Association; Creative Choices; Society for Editors and Proofreaders

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into more senior editorial roles, or work on a freelance basis.

Description.Html: Education welfare officers make sure that children attend school and get the support they need.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working in education welfare through the education welfare service of your local council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training you could become a team leader, senior education welfare officer or a head of service.

You could also train for a career in social services, the probation service, youth work or pastoral care.

Description.Html: E-learning developers create course materials that can be studied on a computer network or online.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Learning and Performance Institute for professional development opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Blackboard and Moodle are widely used by education institutions and an understanding of how these work will be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the e-learning industry through the eLearning Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to a senior development role, IT project management, e-learning research, strategy planning, technical sales and business development.

You could also move into related areas like educational or training consultancy, educational software development, systems analysis or the computer games industry.

Description.Html: Electrical engineers design, build and maintain electrical systems, machinery and equipment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training from Electrical Careers and The Institution of Engineering and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work in different industries, from power and renewable energy to transport, construction and manufacturing.

You can improve your career prospects with incorporated or chartered engineer status. Chartered status can help you move into electrical design and project management roles, specialise in a particular field, or work as an engineering consultant. The Engineering Council have further details on how to become a chartered engineer.

Description.Html: Electrical engineering technicians install, repair and maintain electrical equipment and controls.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details on careers in electrical engineering through Tomorrow's Engineers and The Institution of Engineering and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into supervisory jobs, electrical design work or take further training to qualify as an engineer.

You could become a self-employed electrical sub-contractor.

Description.Html: Electricians fit, service and fix electrical equipment, circuits, machinery and wiring.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an electrician from Electrical Careers and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into design engineering, site or project management, consultancy work or training.

You could also set up your own business.

Description.Html: Electricity distribution workers maintain and repair the power lines that connect homes and businesses to the national grid.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in the power industry from the Talent Source Network and National Grid.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader.

With further study you could become an electrical engineering technician or network control engineer.

Description.Html: Electricity generation workers operate and maintain equipment in power stations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the power industry from Talent Source Network and National Grid.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a supervisor, control and instrumentation engineer or operations or maintenance technician.

You could also take a foundation degree, higher national diploma or degree in power engineering and become an electrical or mechanical engineer.

Description.Html: Electronics engineers design and develop systems for industry, from mobile communications to manufacturing and aerospace.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training from Electrical Careers and The Institution of Engineering and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With incorporated or chartered engineer status you could:

  • move into project management roles
  • specialise in research, such as telecommunications, robotics or semiconductors
  • work as an engineering consultant

You could also move into patent law.

Description.Html: Electronics engineering technicians design, build and maintain electronic systems and components.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about courses and careers in engineering from Tomorrow's Engineers and The Institution of Engineering and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a project team leader or a maintenance or quality control manager.

Description.Html: Embalmers preserve and prepare bodies for burial or cremation.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Institute of Embalmers for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working as an embalmer through the British Institute of Embalmers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become self-employed and work independently with several funeral directors.

You could go on to take further training and specialise in HIV or tuberculosis work, or join a team responding to disasters.

You could also become a funeral director.

Description.Html: Emergency care assistants drive ambulances under emergency conditions and support paramedics.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an emergency care assistant from:Health Careers; College of Paramedics; Local Ambulance Trusts

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could apply for a trainee technician job or a student paramedic post. You could then take an approved paramedic science degree, leading to registration as a paramedic.

You could also become a team leader or supervisor with responsibility for a team of ECAs, or move into a human resources or training role.

Description.Html: Emergency medical dispatchers handle calls from the public and GPs requesting an ambulance.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an emergency medical dispatcher from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a team leader or control room superintendent.

Description.Html: Energy engineers research, design and build power generation plants, and work in the oil and gas industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on energy engineering careers from the Energy Institute, [National Grid Careers | https://careers.nationalgrid.com/] and Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into planning, policy development, or freelance consultancy.

Description.Html: Engineering construction craftworkers fit and repair machinery and equipment on structures ranging from oil rigs to sports stadiums.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers and training in craft engineering from the Engineering and Construction Industry Training Board and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a chargehand or supervisory management role.

With further training you could become an engineering technician.

Description.Html: Engineering construction technicians install, service and repair machines and equipment in buildings, factories and industrial plants.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about technician careers from the Engineering Construction Industry Training Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to site management jobs or specialise in particular areas, like engineering design, testing or procurement.

With a degree you could qualify as an engineer.

Description.Html: Engineering craft machinists use lathes, cutters and grinders to make parts used in manufacturing and engineering.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about engineering careers from Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a shift supervisor of a production section or whole workshop. With further training, you may be able to work as an engineering technician.

Your engineering craft skills will be useful in lots of different industries from aerospace to car manufacturing, so you may be able to specialise in one area or move between them, as your experience grows.

Description.Html: Engineering maintenance technicians service and repair equipment in industries like manufacturing, production and transport.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about engineering careers through Tomorrow's Engineers and The Institution of Engineering and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could eventually qualify as an engineer in your particular field, like mechanical or electrical engineering.

You could also move into technical sales, maintenance team management and contract management.

Description.Html: Engineering operatives use hand and machine tools to do jobs across different industries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on training and working in engineering from the Engineering Construction Industry Training Board and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With further training, you could progress to a skilled craft-level job, and then on to technician level.

TitlePart.Title: English as a foreign language (EFL) teacher

Description.Html: EFL teachers help students learn or improve their English in the UK and abroad.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more details on TEFL qualifications from Trinity College London and Cambridge English.

You can find out more about how to become a teacher in further education from FE Advice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may be able to progress to a management position in a commercial language school or a college.

You could also move into private tuition or teacher training. You could open your own language school or write EFL learning materials, online resources and apps.

data.DisplayText: English as a foreign language (EFL) teacher
data.Author: admin

Description.Html: Entertainers perform for audiences in stage, cabaret or comedy shows.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join Equity for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll often have to pass auditions to get work. It may help to find an agent who can market your talents.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an entertainer from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into related roles like entertainment agent, talent spotter, venue management, or TV or radio presenting.

Description.Html: Entertainment agents promote careers in the entertainment industry and manage performers' and other professionals' business affairs.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join a trade association like The Entertainment Agents' Association Ltd for networking opportunities and specialist advice.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Your experience, paid or unpaid, your enthusiasm and your ability to make contacts are more important than academic qualifications.

Foreign language skills and knowledge of contract law could also be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working as an agent from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for an agency or artist management company, be self-employed or set up your own agency.

Your progression will depend on building a strong reputation, and attracting top performers onto your books.

Description.Html: Environmental consultants advise on sustainability, including waste management, recycling, flood risk and the effects of climate change.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Society for the Environment for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
As a graduate you could look for postgraduate training opportunities offered through a Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP).

In a KTP you would get the opportunity to run a research project together with an industrial organisation and a university or research body. You may also work towards postgraduate qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about environmental work and training through the Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into an associate role, or senior or principal consultant position.

Other options include lecturing or running your own consultancy business.

Description.Html: Environmental health officers make sure people's surroundings are safe, healthy and hygienic.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Institute of Environmental Health for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about training and working in environmental health through the Chartered Institute of Environmental Health.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could apply for Chartered Environmental Health Practitioner status.

In local government you could progress to senior, principal or chief environmental health officer. You could also become a university lecturer.

Description.Html: Equalities officers promote practices and attitudes to make sure people from minority groups are treated equally within organisations.

HtbBodies.Html: Some employers will prefer you to be a member of the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may need to qualify as a teacher first if you want to work as an equality and diversity officer in schools.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as an equalities officer from the Equality and Human Rights Commission.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior officer and work towards accreditation with the Institute of Equality and Diversity Professionals.

You could also work as a consultant or move into general management.

Description.Html: Ergonomists help to make sure that equipment and machinery is safe and easy to use

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Ergonomics & Human Factors for professional development training, events and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more about careers and training in ergonomics from the Chartered Institute of Ergonomics & Human Factors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress into line management or project management.

You could move into consultancy work, or provide specialist services like workplace design or health and safety.

Description.Html: Estate agents sell and rent out commercial and residential property, acting as negotiators between buyers and sellers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find our more about working as an estate agent from NAEA Propertymark.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a good sales record, you could be promoted from sales negotiator to senior negotiator and then branch manager.

Larger chains of estate agents may offer more opportunities for promotion than smaller companies.

You could also become self-employed as a partner in a firm, or set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Estates officers are responsible for the management and upkeep of land and property belonging to local councils and public bodies.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training and working in estate management through The Chartered Institute of Building and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you may be able to progress to estates manager, or specialise in a particular area.

Description.Html: Estimators work out how much it will cost for a company to supply products and services to its clients.

HtbBodies.Html: You could apply to join the Association of Cost Engineers for professional development, networking opportunities and industry news.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in construction and engineering from Go Construct and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a project team leader, quality assurance inspector or contracts manager.

You could also move into a related area, like quantity surveying, supply chain or general management.

Description.Html: European Union (EU) officials work for institutions like the European Commission or the European Parliament.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You must apply for jobs at all grades through an annual selection process known as an 'open competition'. This involves computer-based testing in your home country, and an assessment stage held in Brussels.

If you're successful at the assessment stage, you'll be put on a reserve list for up to 1 year. Candidates from the reserve list will then be selected for interview when a suitable job comes up.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a European Union official from EU Careers.

Details on how to apply can be found from the European Personnel Selection Office.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to higher grades. There is a clear promotion structure, with regular reviews, exams and competitions for progression.

Description.Html: Events managers organise and run promotional, business and social events.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association of Event Organisers and Eventia for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You could start by organising events and activities for your family, friends, school or college.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an events manager from:Association of Event Organisers; Hospitality Guild; Creative Choices

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a good track record, you could run events that have larger budgets and eventually progress to management.

You could work freelance or set up your own events management business.

Description.Html: Exhibition designers work with organisations and individuals to turn their ideas into engaging displays.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Society of Designers, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to put together a portfolio of your work to highlight your design skills to show at interview. Work experience would also give you an advantage when applying for training and jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an exhibition designer from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you may be able to progress to a more senior position, like team leader or senior designer.

You could also become freelance, or set up your own company.

Description.Html: Facilities managers oversee the operation and maintenance of building systems and services.

HtbBodies.Html: You could apply to become a member of the Institute of Workplace and Facilities Management for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful to have a health and safety qualification.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a facilities manager from the Institute of Workplace and Facilities Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you may be able to progress to senior or regional manager roles.

Description.Html: Fairground workers operate rides and carry out maintenance at theme parks or travelling fairgrounds.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a supervisory management post, especially in larger parks.

You could move into other types of work within the fair or theme park, like working in shops and catering outlets, cleaning, security work, and in some cases, caring for and managing animals.

Description.Html: Family mediators help divorcing or separating couples reach agreement without having to go to court.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some family law solicitors and legal executives choose to train and work as mediators although law qualifications are not essential for this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working in family mediation through the Family Mediation Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could set up your own mediation practice, train and supervise other mediators, or become a service manager.

You could use your mediation skills in other careers like housing, social work or advice work.

Description.Html: Family support workers help and advise families with long or short-term difficulties.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in support work from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and qualifications you could focus on a particular area, like working with people with disabilities.

You could also progress to team leader (managing a group of support workers) or become an assistant manager of a family centre or refuge.

Experience in family support may help if you want to move into social work.

Description.Html: Farm secretaries are responsible for the day-to-day running of the business side of farms.

HtbCareerTips.Html: An understanding of farming or rural life will be helpful, particularly if you've lived or worked on a farm before.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a farm secretary through The Institute of Agricultural Secretaries and Administrators.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a farm manager.

You could also move into other types of rural business, like stables or countryside management, or use your business and administrative skills in other industries.

Description.Html: Farm workers raise livestock and plant and harvest crops, using agricultural machinery.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may help to have some basic skills in mechanics.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in farming and agriculture from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With qualifications and experience, you could progress to supervisor or unit manager on a large farm. You may have to move between farms to gain experience and promotion.

You could also become an agricultural contractor, supplying services to several farms, servicing machinery or working in agricultural equipment and supplies.

Description.Html: Farmers and farm managers grow crops and raise livestock for food production.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on farming careers from Tasty Careers and the National Land Based College.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into related areas, like agricultural advisory work for government bodies, consultancy or training.

Description.Html: Farriers prepare and treat horses' hooves, and make and fit horseshoes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about training and working as a farrier from the Farriers Registration Council and the British Farriers and Blacksmiths Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You may be able to move into a permanent role with large stables, horse breeders, or mounted regiments of the police or army.

You could work in equine hospitals, with vets or in the farriery suppliers business.

You could become an Approved Training Farrier (ATF) and employ and train apprentice Farriers.

You could also move into lecturing or provide a consultancy service.

Description.Html: Fashion design assistants help designers to create new materials, styles, colours and patterns for fashion brands and labels.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to put together a portfolio of your work to take to course and job interviews. This should include mood boards, designs and drawings. An employer or college may also ask you to take along actual clothes that you've produced.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in fashion from the British Fashion Council and Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a fashion designer, then senior designer or design director. As a design director you could create your own range and manage a design team.

You could also move into freelance design, working on individual projects, or self-employment, creating your own collections.

Description.Html: Fashion designers design clothing and fashion ranges.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can create a portfolio of your design work to showcase your skills, which will help you at course and job interviews. Your portfolio should include mood boards, designs and technical drawings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in fashion from Creative Choices and the British Fashion Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to senior designer, head of a department (like head of women's wear design) or design director.

You could also go freelance or start your own company.

Description.Html: Fashion models promote clothing and accessory brands at fashion events and in magazines and digital media.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join Equity for professional advice and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
There's a lot of competition for modelling jobs. You'll improve your chances of finding work if you build up a good portfolio and get experience and contacts.

Model agencies are not allowed to charge an up-front fee for you to join them.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a fashion model from the British Fashion Model Agents Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a booker for a model agency or set up your own agency. You could also move into other areas of the fashion industry like styling or fashion journalism.

You might also find opportunities in areas like TV presenting or acting.

Description.Html: Film critics analyse films and produce reviews and articles for newspapers, magazines, radio, TV, social media channels and websites.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You’re likely to be self-employed or work freelance as a film critic, especially when starting out, and be paid per review. Some critics write about other media, for example TV, plays and books, to supplement their income.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about being a film critic from Creative Choices.

You can get more general information about working and training in journalism from the National Union of Journalists and National Council for the Training of Journalists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: As an established film critic, you could combine your job with writing books on film, editing, or teaching criticism on film courses. You could also work in film archives.

Description.Html: Finance officers help to manage the finances of an organisation by keeping track of its income and controlling its spending.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in finance from The London Institute of Banking and Finance.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a senior finance officer or finance manager, or train to become an accountant.

Description.Html: Financial advisers help people and organisations to choose investments, savings, pensions, mortgages and insurance products.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on working in financial services through The London Institute of Banking & Finance.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you work for a large financial organisation, you could specialise in one area of work like retirement planning. You could also move into management, recruiting and training new staff.

With further specialised professional qualifications, you could become a director or partner in your firm.

Another option is to move into compliance work, making sure your company is following industry guidelines.

Description.Html: Fine artists create original works of art using methods like painting, drawing and sculpture.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll need to be able to promote yourself in different ways, like:

  • having an online presence through your own website, blog or through social media, like Instagram
  • joining together with other artists or 'collectives'
  • organising your own shows in galleries or other venues

You could also:

  • get an agent
  • raise funds through crowdfunding websites
  • illustrate products like books or greetings cards

Entering competitions or open exhibitions can also raise your profile as an artist. The Artists Information Company regularly lists opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a fine artist from:Creative Choices; Guild Society of Artists; Artquest

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into areas like art therapy or art conservation.

Description.Html: Fingerprint officers check and compare fingerprints taken from crime scenes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a fingerprint officer from The Chartered Society of Forensic Sciences and the College of Policing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a scenes of crime officer (SOCO).

With further training you could move into forensic science or become a criminal intelligence officer.

Description.Html: Firefighters help to protect people from fire and other dangers, and give advice on fire prevention.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Most fire services take on new recruits once every 12 months, so you’ll need to find out when they are recruiting next.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can ask your local fire and rescue service for a firefighter careers and recruitment pack.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
All fire services have a programme that lets you plan and track your career development.

You could work your way up to crew manager, watch manager or station manager. If you're prepared to move between services, you could also become an area manager, a brigade manager or a chief fire officer.

If you're involved in fire safety and prevention work, you can take professional qualifications leading to membership of the Institution of Fire Engineers (IFE).

You could also get a Heavy Goods Vehicle (HGV) licence for driving fire engines.

Description.Html: Fish farmers work in small teams to breed and rear fish and shellfish, and harvest them for market.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the fisheries industry through the Institute of Fisheries Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into areas like fisheries management, biological science or environmental research by taking a degree qualification.

On a larger farm, you could progress to supervisor or manager.

You could start your own fish farm.

Description.Html: Fish friers work in fish and chip shops and seafood restaurants. They prepare and cook food, and serve customers.

HtbBodies.Html: Industry bodies Seafish and the National Federation of Fish Friers have more information about working in the seafood industry.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a shop supervisor or manager.

You could also move into catering management or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Deckhands clear the decks, prepare and maintain equipment and handle the catch on offshore fishing vessels.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more information about careers in the fishing industry from Seafish.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work towards becoming a skipper. Inshore skippers can operate their own small boat (up to 16.5m). Further training is needed for larger vessels.

You could also use your experience to move into related areas like the Merchant Navy or harbour tug work.

Description.Html: Fishing vessel skippers are in charge of the crew onboard sea-going fishing boats.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers in the fishing industry from Seafish.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you may be able to move into related careers, like the Merchant Navy, harbour tug work, fish farming, offshore oil or gas exploration, offshore energy development, cargo operations or ferries.

Description.Html: Fishmongers sell fish and seafood products, and advise customers on how to prepare them.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the seafood industry from Seafish.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training you could become an assistant manager in a supermarket, a seafood chef or set up your own business.

You could also move into seafood wholesaling, supplying shops and restaurants.

Description.Html: Fitness instructors organise exercise programmes to improve people's health and fitness.
