HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Register of Exercise Professionals and the Chartered Institute for the Management of Sport and Physical Activity for professional development and to help with your career prospects.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could take further training to become a personal trainer or teach extra activities.

With experience and qualifications, you could become a senior instructor or manager. You could also start your own fitness club.

Description.Html: Florists sell flowers and design bouquets for weddings, funerals and special occasions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in floristry through the British Florist Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could start your own business or become a freelance floral decorator, doing exhibition work, demonstrations and teaching.

Description.Html: Food factory workers make frozen, tinned, baked and dried products.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a shift supervisor or move into quality control.

You could improve your job prospects by taking an industry qualification like a diploma in food team leading.

Description.Html: Food manufacturing inspectors make sure companies meet hygiene and safety standards, and that products are safe to eat.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in food safety from the Chartered Institute of Environmental Health.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a food safety manager, co-ordinating the work of a team of inspectors.

You could also move into environmental health or food science after training.

Description.Html: Food packaging operatives work on production lines to put food and drink products into containers, cans or packets.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Food scientists and food technologists develop food and drink products, making sure they are safe to consume.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a food scientist from the Institute of Food Science and Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for a range of organisations involved in researching and developing new products, including:

  • food manufacturers and supermarkets
  • government and university research establishments
  • local authorities

You could improve your career prospects by getting Registered Scientist (RSci) or Chartered Scientist (CSci) status through the Institute of Food Science and Technology.

With experience you could become a project leader or manage a department like research and development or quality control. You could also move into fields like chemical engineering, agricultural research, toxicology or nutrition science.

Description.Html: Football coaches develop the skills and motivation of football players and teams.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in coaching through The Football Association and UK Coaching.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a community coach, with further training you could move into sports development or youth work.

As a coach for a professional team, you could move to a bigger or higher profile club.

You could also move into a specialist area like sports psychology or goalkeeping coaching.

The FA Licensed Coaches' Club offers continuing training and progression for coaches.

Description.Html: Football referees officiate at football matches, from local youth and amateur leagues up to professional level.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the The Referees' Association for support and professional development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a referee from The Football Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could train to become a referee training instructor, match assessor or referee development officer with a County FA.

You could also use your knowledge and experience to move into related areas, like sports development in the community.

Description.Html: Footballers play for their club in league and cup competitions, and some represent their country at international level.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Professional Footballers' Association for personal development and support, both during and after your playing career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about the women's and men's professional game from The FA and the Professional Footballers' Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress by transferring to a club higher up in the football leagues.

You could move into related careers like coaching, fitness instruction, refereeing, management, sports development, physiotherapy or journalism.

Description.Html: Footwear designers create new designs and sample patterns for men's, women's and children's footwear.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's very important to put together a portfolio of work that you can take to interviews. This should include designs, technical drawings and mood boards to show your creative talents.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in footwear design through Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience within a company, you could progress to senior designer, design director or head of department.

You could also become a freelance designer, employed by companies to work on specific projects, or become self-employed and launch your own collection.

Description.Html: Footwear manufacturing operatives make shoes, boots and sports footwear for all ages.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Footwear Association for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in footwear manufacturing from the British Footwear Association and Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into supervisory management, machinery maintenance or quality control. With further training, you could take up a career in footwear design or as a footwear technologist.

You could also specialise in custom-made footwear, like luxury bespoke shoes, orthopaedic footwear, or historical and theatrical costume footwear.

Description.Html: Forensic computer analysts investigate computer-based crime, often called cyber crime.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in digital security from the National Cyber Security Centre and The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior analyst, head of security or security consultant.

Description.Html: Forensic psychologists explore what makes people commit crimes.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the The British Psychological Society for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers in forensic psychology from [The British Psychological Society | https://careers.bps.org.uk/area/forensic] and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could go on to run a prison psychology department, move into a policy and strategy-based role or a management post focusing on specific issues.

You could also move into freelance and consultancy work, for example as an expert witness.

Description.Html: Forensic scientists prepare traces of physical evidence for use in courts of law.

HtbCareerTips.Html: If you want to specialise in recovering data from computers and mobile phones, you'll need relevant experience and qualifications. Useful subjects include computing, electrical engineering, electronics or physics.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more on careers in forensics from The Chartered Society of Forensic Sciences.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management and direct other forensics staff as a forensics manager or casework examiner.

You could also work as a reporting scientist, acting as an expert witness in court.

Description.Html: Forest officers manage forestry workers, plan harvesting activities and monitor planted areas.

HtbBodies.Html: You could apply for membership of the Institute of Chartered Foresters, which may help with your career prospects and professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Most employers will expect you to have 2 to 3 years' woodland experience to become a forestry officer.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers and training in forestry through the Royal Forestry Society and The Arboricultural Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into consultancy work or a university research role.

Description.Html: Forestry workers manage trees, plants and the environment in forests and woodland.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Chartered Foresters, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in forestry from the Royal Forestry Society and Forestry England.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to senior forest worker or become a forest or arboricultural officer.

You could also become a forest ranger, working with wardens or conservation officers to look after wildlife.

Description.Html: Forklift drivers load and unload goods in warehouses, ports and airports.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Make sure you get a copy of your forklift training certificate so you can use it for job applications. Unlike a driving licence, no forklift licence is issued.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working as a forklift driver in construction from Go Construct.

You can find details of approved forklift training providers through the Accrediting Bodies Association - Workplace Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a shift supervisor or team leader. With further training, you could work as a forklift instructor or maintenance engineer.

You could also become a warehouse manager.

You could move into industries like construction (construction plant operator) or logistics (lorry driver).

Description.Html: Forklift truck engineers service and repair lift trucks.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a repair workshop supervisor or plant hire centre manager.

You could also do further training to work on construction machinery, or become an electrical or mechanical engineer.

Description.Html: Foster carers look after children and young people who can't be looked after in their own homes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about fostering through the Fostering Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Foundry moulders make moulds to shape molten metal into castings used to make parts for industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the metals industry from the Institute of Cast Metals Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into supervisory management, quality control or engineering design as you get more experience.

Description.Html: Foundry process operators make metal castings and parts used in industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the metals industry from the Institute of Cast Metals Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can move into supervisory jobs or more skilled foundry work, like pattern making, moulding or coremaking.

With further training, you could switch to other areas of engineering, like welding, metal fabrication or industrial blacksmithing.

Description.Html: Franchise owners are self-employed people who've bought a licence to operate a business under an established company's brand.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need access to money to buy the franchise and pay ongoing agreement fees.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about running a franchise from the British Franchise Association and Business is Great.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: Once your business becomes established you may want to open more franchised outlets. This would allow you to hand over day-to-day operations to staff, so you can concentrate on managing the growth of your chain.

Description.Html: French polishers use traditional skills to treat wood and restore furniture and items like staircases, doors and musical instruments.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Guild of Master Craftsmen for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a french polisher from The Guild of Master Craftsmen.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager.

You could start your own business.

Description.Html: Funeral directors make arrangements for burials and cremations, and provide support and advice for the bereaved.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about training to work in the funeral service from the British Institute of Funeral Directors and the National Association of Funeral Directors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With larger organisations, you could be promoted to branch, area or regional management.

With experience and qualifications you could become a tutor and teach NAFD qualifications.

Description.Html: Furniture designers create designs for mass-produced furniture, furniture made in small batches and one-off pieces.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Society of Designers to get access to professional development training, technical advice and information about setting up your own business.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to keep a portfolio of work to showcase your design skills to potential employers or customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in furniture design from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a more senior design position, or into a specialised area, like ergonomics.

You could also set up your own design consultancy.

Description.Html: Furniture makers make and restore items like chairs, tables, beds and display cabinets.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Furniture Makers' Company for professional recognition and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in furniture making through Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a workshop supervisor or quality control inspector. With further training, you could move into furniture design.

In larger firms, you could work in estimating, retail buying, sales or training.

You could also start your own business and specialise in hand-crafted furniture or restoring antique items.

Description.Html: Furniture restorers repair and conserve modern and antique pieces of furniture.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training and careers in furniture restoration and conservation through:Creative Choices; The Institute of Conservation; The British Antique Furniture Restorers' Association

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could set up your own furniture restoration business, carrying out work for organisations and the public, or work as a consultant for museums, auction houses, historical or heritage sites, or antique dealers.

Description.Html: Further education (FE) lecturers teach adult learners, students over 16, and students aged 14 to 16 on work-related learning.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can get qualified teacher learning and skills status while you work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in further education from Get Into Teaching and FE advice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior lecturer or head of department, or move into management. You could also become a a training assessor.

Another option is to work as an examiner, or write textbooks or online education resources.

Description.Html: Gamekeepers manage countryside areas used for shooting and fishing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the National Gamekeepers' Organisation for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers value experience of working outdoors and knowledge of the countryside. Practical skills like carpentry would also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about becoming a gamekeeper through the National Gamekeepers' Organisation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to head keeper.

You could also become self-employed by renting the shooting rights to land, or working as a contractor.

Description.Html: Garage managers are responsible for the day-to-day running of a garage workshop.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the motor industry from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a fleet maintenance, service centre, or general business manager with a manufacturer's dealership.

You might also become a technical manager, specialising in a particular area like heavy commercial vehicles or motor sport.

You may find professional training like the IMI Accreditation for Management could help your career prospects.

Description.Html: Garden nursery assistants grow plants in nurseries and garden centres, and advise and serve customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in horticulture from Grow Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a nursery supervisor.

You may be able to move into horticultural technician work or garden centre management by completing industry qualifications like those from the Royal Horticultural Society.

Description.Html: Gardeners grow and look after plants in private and public green spaces.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a gardener from Grow Careers and Horticulture Week.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior or head gardener.

You could move into other work like landscaping, greenkeeping or the care of trees and shrubs (arboriculture).

You could also set up your own business, offering a service to private customers.

Description.Html: Garment technologists choose the right fabrics and designs for manufacturers to make clothes at a set cost.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in garment technology through the British Fashion Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior technologist, quality controller or technical production manager.

You could also move into research or teaching in a university fashion and textiles department.

Description.Html: Gas mains layers install and maintain the pipelines that supply homes and businesses with gas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the gas industry from Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader and possibly into management.

With further study you could move into field or project engineering.

Description.Html: Gas service technicians install, service and repair gas appliances and heating systems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in the gas industry from Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into gas engineering, or supervisory and management roles.

You could also set up your own gas fitting business, but you’d need considerable experience to do this.

Description.Html: General practice surveyors are involved in the management, valuation, buying, selling and development of land and property.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a general practice surveyor from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into a specialist area like auctioning land, property or plant and machinery, or the valuation and auctioning of fine arts and antiques.

Description.Html: Geneticists study genes to work out how cells and organisms behave.

HtbBodies.Html: You may improve your career prospects by joining a professional body like The Genetics Society.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in genetics from The Genetics Society and the The British Society for Genetic Medicine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a research geneticist, with experience you may be able to work your way up to laboratory supervisor or clinical study manager. Lecturing in a university or teaching may also be an option.

You could move into scientific sales or, with further studies, qualify as a genetic counsellor.

Description.Html: Geoscientists study the Earth's structure and formation, and analyse rocks to explore its natural mineral and energy resources.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about careers in geoscience through The Geological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress towards a consultant position, or move into teaching or management.

Description.Html: Geospatial technicians collect data to create maps, update satellite navigation systems and plan construction projects.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association for Geographic Information for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many geospatial technicians use specialist software. You could build up your skills and knowledge through free online learning resources.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in geographical information systems from:Royal Geographic Society; Geospatial World; ESRI Careers; Ordnance Survey

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can specialise in areas like agriculture, mining, healthcare, urban planning or military intelligence.

After 3 to 5 years' experience, you can become a GIS analyst or geographic information officer.

Description.Html: Geotechnicians collect and analyse geological data from rock, soil and water samples.

HtbBodies.Html: You can get recognition of your technical skills by registering with the Science Council as a Registered Science Technician (RSciTech).

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers and training in geoscience from The Geological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could train as a geoscientist.

You could also move into management, or into another sector and become a laboratory technician in a school or college.

Description.Html: Glassmakers produce a variety of objects from windows, for buildings and vehicles, to bottles, crystal vases and test tubes.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You may find qualifications like GCSEs in science, design and technology, or art helpful, depending on whether you want to specialise in glass manufacturing or crafts.

For craftwork, you'll need both technical skills and artistic ability.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about craft glassmaking from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In a glass factory, you may have the opportunity to move into supervisory or management positions.

You could also start your own business.

Description.Html: Glaziers install and repair glass in houses, hotels, offices and shops.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a glazier from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work on specialist projects, like restoration work on churches or listed buildings.

Other options include moving into site management, estimating or glass product design.

You could also work in the automotive industry, repairing and replacing windscreens on vehicles.

Description.Html: General practitioners (GPs) are doctors who provide medical services to people in their practice.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Medical Association, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a GP from Health Careers and the Royal College of General Practitioners.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into medical work in hospitals, pharmaceutical companies, the police or the prison service.

You could also work in education, teaching students training to be GPs.

You might also get involved in local health issues, maybe as a member of a local medical committee or clinical commissioning group.

Description.Html: GP practice managers run the business side of doctors' surgeries and health centres.

HtbBodies.Html: Membership of The Association of Medical Secretaries, Practice Managers, Administrators and Receptionists (AMSPAR) and the Institute of Healthcare Management will give you access to professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a GP practice manager from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a partner (part-owner) of the practice.

You might move into healthcare management in a hospital, health authority or NHS trust.

You could also work as a manager in a social services department, or you could work in private healthcare.

Description.Html: Graphic designers create visual branding, adverts, brochures, magazines, website designs, product packaging and displays.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Society of Designers and the International Society of Typographical Designers for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: There's a lot of competition for graphic design work. You'll need a portfolio that shows your creative ideas, skills and work experience to help you get started.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in graphic design from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior designer, creative director or move into management.

You could go freelance or start your own design agency.

Another option is to move into teaching or lecturing.

Description.Html: A groundsperson, or greenkeeper, looks after sports grounds like football, cricket or rugby pitches.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Groundsmanship for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers and training as a groundsperson from the Institute of Groundsmanship.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisor, team leader or head of section.

You could get training from the Institute of Groundsmanship (IOG).

Description.Html: Hairdressers cut, colour and shape clients' hair to create the look they want.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in hairdressing from the Hair and Beauty Industry Authority.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a senior stylist or salon manager. With suitable further qualifications, you could also move into training or assessing.

You could also open your own salon.

Other options include wig making, training in make-up techniques and working in the theatre, film and television industries.

Description.Html: Hairdressing salon managers oversee the day-to-day running of a hairdresser's or barber's shop and cut and style hair.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in hairdressing through the Hair and Beauty Industry Authority.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience you could branch out to offer related services like beauty or spa therapies.

You could become an area manager for a hairdressing chain or open your own salon.

You could also go into education as a trainer-assessor, teaching hairdressing students.

Description.Html: Handypersons carry out minor repairs and small jobs in people's homes and businesses.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with older people or people with disabilities in a housing or social care setting can be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers using construction skills from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team leader or jobs coordinator with a service and repair company. You could also move into related areas of work like caretaking.

With formal qualifications you could become a qualified tradesperson, like a carpenter or plumber.

Description.Html: Head chefs oversee restaurants’ staff, food and budgets.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in catering from the Hospitality Guild and CareerScope.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could go on to manage larger kitchens and more staff. You may work for a large restaurant chain managing more than one kitchen. This is a management role and you would do very little cooking.

You could also set up your own business, running your own restaurant or franchise. Some chefs set up their own restaurant brand.

Description.Html: IT directors manage the development of IT systems for their organisation and its customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on careers in computing through The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may be able to become a chief executive or chair of an organisation.

You could also work as an IT consultant or start your own business.

Description.Html: Headteachers manage schools and create the right conditions for children and staff to achieve their best.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can discover more about senior teaching careers from Ambition School Leadership and Get Into Teaching.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Due to the variety of schools in the UK, there are opportunities to move between different types and sizes of school.

You could also train to be an Ofsted inspector, an education adviser, or become a teacher training lecturer in a college or university.

Description.Html: Health and safety advisers work to reduce accidents, injury and health problems in the workplace.

HtbBodies.Html: The Occupational Safety and Health Consultants Register has a list of professional bodies offering membership options.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on careers in health and safety from the Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents and Occupational Safety and Health Consultants Register.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a safety management role.

You could also become a consultant and specialise in a particular area like environmental. construction or food safety. With further study you could move into research, training or lecturing.

Description.Html: Health play specialists understand child development and use therapeutic play activities to help children cope when in hospital.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many health play specialists have a background in nursery work. You could also do this job with experience and qualifications in related areas, like community play, nursing, occupational therapy, social work, teaching, art, drama or music therapy.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a health play specialist from the Healthcare Play Specialist Education Trust and the National Association of Health Play Specialists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could go on to work outside of a hospital setting, for example in a child development centre, hospice, or within a community paediatric team.

With experience, you could progress to team leader or team manager.

You could also apply to train as a healthcare professional, like a nurse or occupational therapist.

Description.Html: Health promotion specialists educate and inform people about health issues.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
There are lots of voluntary and charitable organisations who work on health issues, and there are often job opportunities in the area of health promotion.

You can also find details of current health campaigns and initiatives through the Royal Society for Public Health.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on careers in health promotion through Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a more senior role and have more responsibility for planning projects and strategies.

If you have a postgraduate qualification, you could move into a role where you’ll have responsibility for managing projects and other health promotion specialists.

You could also work as a freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Health records clerks keep people's medical records up to date.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful for professional recognition and training opportunities to join organisations like:Institute of Health Records and Information Management; The Association of Medical Secretaries, Practice Managers, Administrators and Receptionists (AMSPAR); BSMSA

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a health records clerk from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can study with the Institute of Health Record Information and Management (IHRIM) for a more senior role or to specialise in areas such as clinical coding.

With qualifications and experience you could become a medical secretary or a health records manager.

Description.Html: Health service managers run local healthcare services like hospitals, GP practices and community health services.

HtbBodies.Html: You could apply to become a member of the Institute of Healthcare Management. This would give you access to professional development opportunities and professional recognition.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a health service manager from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll increase your chances for career progression if you complete a higher level management qualification, like a Master's in Business Administration (MBA) or a diploma in management studies (DMS).

You could also apply for jobs at director or chief executive level.

Description.Html: Health trainers promote healthy living and help people make healthier lifestyle choices.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a health trainer from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team supervisor, or senior health improvement specialist.

You could also move into related careers in health promotion or community development.

Description.Html: Health visitors work with families in their own homes to promote healthy lifestyles and prevent illness.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about how to become a health visitor from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team manager, community matron or a management role in another department of the NHS.

You could also go into nurse education and training.

Description.Html: Healthcare assistants look after patients in hospitals or in patients’ own homes.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join the Royal College of Nursing, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a healthcare assistant from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could train new healthcare assistants.

With training, you could become an assistant practitioner in chiropody or podiatry, occupational therapy, radiography or physiotherapy.

You could also apply to train as a nurse, radiographer, dietitian, midwife or social worker.

Health Careers has information about careers in all areas of health.

Description.Html: Healthcare science assistants support healthcare professionals.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join organisations like the Academy for Healthcare Science for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a healthcare science assistant from:Health Careers; Academy for Healthcare Science; Institute of Biomedical Science

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could apply for a senior post as a healthcare science associate.

With a degree you could work towards becoming a healthcare scientist or biomedical scientist, or apply for the NHS Practitioner Training Programme.

You could also train to become a cardiological technician, cardiographer, cervical cytology screener or phlebotomist.

Description.Html: Heating and ventilation engineers install and service heating and air conditioning in large buildings like factories, schools and hospitals.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working and training in heating and ventilation from the Building and Engineering Services Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into a managerial role or technical sales.

Description.Html: Helicopter engineers service and repair helicopters.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a helicopter engineer from The British Helicopter Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a maintenance engineering manager or senior design engineer, working on modifications and enhancements to aircraft.

Description.Html: Helicopter pilots fly single- and multi-engined helicopters for business, leisure or emergency services.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the The Honourable Company of Air Pilots, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
If you're thinking of a career as a helicopter pilot, it's strongly recommended that you consider taking a pilot Aptitude Assessment before you start training.

You could also take a trial lesson with a flight school to make sure this is the right career for you.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a helicopter pilot from:Careers in Aerospace; British Helicopter Association; The Honourable Company of Air Pilots; Flying Start

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could combine flying with ground duties, recruitment or training.

You could also start your own business providing recreational flights or freight services, or become a flying instructor.

Description.Html: Higher education (HE) lecturers research and teach academic and vocational subjects at universities and higher education colleges.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in higher education from the HE Academy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for universities and colleges, law and business schools, or private sector universities and schools.

After 5 to 7 years you could become a senior lecturer. You could then become a principal lecturer, reader or professor. Competition is strong and promotion depends on how well you perform.

Description.Html: Highways cleaners keep footpaths, green spaces and streets clean, and deal with litter, graffiti, and items left by the public.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With qualifications and experience you could progress to become a supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Homeopaths believe that you can use homeopathic remedies to stimulate the body to heal itself.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about a career in homeopathy through the following organisations:Alliance of Registered Homeopaths; The Homeopathic Medical Association; Society of Homeopaths

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into teaching homeopathic courses. You could also work in journalism, specialising in complementary therapies.

You may decide to work in the manufacture of homeopathic remedies and products.

Description.Html: Horse grooms look after horses' everyday needs, and make sure they're healthy and in good condition.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training and working in the horse racing industry from Careers in Racing and the British Grooms Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could take charge of a yard or become head groom.

In a racing yard, you could progress to head lad or girl, travelling head lad or girl, or to assistant trainer or trainer.

On a stud farm, you could become a stud groom, stallion handler or stud manager.

If you work in a riding stable you could become a riding instructor.

Description.Html: Horse riding instructors teach people of different ages, riding ability and experience how to ride.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about becoming a riding instructor from the:British Horse Society; Association of British Riding Schools; Riding for the Disabled Association

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become self-employed and work on a freelance basis for several centres. You could also run your own riding school, become a head or senior instructor, a competition judge, or move into management.

Once experienced, you could also apply for the IGEQ Equestrian Passport, making it easier for you to find work abroad.

Description.Html: A horticultural manager grows plants commercially for use in parks, gardens and public spaces.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a horticultural manager from The Royal Horticultural Society and Grow Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move to a senior management position or set up your own nursery or garden centre.

You could complete The Royal Horticultural Society (RHS) Master of Horticulture qualification, if you have the RHS Level 3 Diploma or equivalent and at least 4 years of experience.

Description.Html: Horticultural therapists use gardening to improve their clients' health and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Association of Social and Horticultural Therapeutic Practitioners for access to local groups, industry newsletters and support from mentors.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may have an advantage if you are moving into this career from other areas of horticulture or jobs such as social care, occupational therapy, nursing or teaching.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a horticultural therapist from Thrive and the Chartered Institute of Horticulture.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could use horticultural therapy as part of a wider role, like occupational therapy. With experience and further study, you could move into a supervisory role, or research.

You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: Horticultural workers grow and sell plants in garden centres, and tend to plants in parks and gardens.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Getting experience and skills from working in related jobs like gardening, forestry or farming could be useful.

Customer service experience would also be helpful if you want to work in a garden centre.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in horticulture through Grow Careers and The Royal Horticultural Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to a supervisor or manager role, or set up your own nursery or garden maintenance business.

You could move into a research job for a university, or with a food and agricultural development company.

Description.Html: A hospital doctor diagnoses and treats illness and disease in patients admitted to hospital.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Medical Association, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a doctor and studying medicine from the British Medical Association and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may go on to lead a team or manage a department.

With experience and entry on the General Medical Council (GMC) Specialist Register, you could apply for senior (or consultant) roles.

You may also progress to teaching and training students, trainee doctors and other healthcare professionals.

Description.Html: Hospital porters move patients, equipment and medical supplies around a hospital.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a hospital porter from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or supervisor. You may need to have, or be working towards, qualifications in supervision and management.

You could also move into a related role like the ambulance service, healthcare assistant work, or nursing.

Description.Html: Hotel managers are in charge of the day-to-day running of a hotel.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Hospitality for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in hotel management from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your career prospects will depend on the size of the business, your experience and whether you are willing to relocate.

In larger hotel chains, you could move into regional management or specialise in areas like corporate finance or training. You may also have the chance to work overseas with an international hotel group.

Description.Html: Hotel porters welcome guests, carry their luggage and answer their questions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about becoming a hotel porter through the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to head porter or concierge.

With training, you could move into other areas of hotel work like bar work or reception.

Description.Html: Hotel receptionists make guests feel welcome, manage new room bookings and reservations, and deal with requests from guests.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful if you can speak a second language, as a lot of hotels get visitors from outside the UK.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on careers and training in the hotel industry from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and qualifications, you may be able to progress to front office manager or hotel manager. You could also move into different areas of hotel work, like events, sales, personnel or accounts.

You might decide to move outside the hospitality industry into related areas like customer service and administration.

Description.Html: Hotel room attendants make sure that hotel rooms are clean, tidy and inviting for guests.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in hotels from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your opportunities for progression would depend on the size of the hotel.

In larger organisations you’re more likely to be able to progress to a supervisory or management job.

Description.Html: Housekeepers organise hotel staff to make sure that all the rooms are kept clean and tidy.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You might have an advantage if you have a background in customer service, cleaning or portering.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about housekeeping careers through the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to head housekeeper or accommodation manager.

You could move into a related hotel job, like front-of-house manager, training manager, or domestic services management.

Description.Html: Housing officers look after rented properties for local authorities and housing associations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers and training in housing from the Chartered Institute of Housing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could specialise in an area of housing like homelessness or anti-social behaviour.

You could also move into management and become a senior housing officer, regional manager, head of service or director.

Description.Html: Housing policy officers research and develop policies for local authorities and housing associations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in housing from the Chartered Institute of Housing and the National Housing Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could specialise in a particular policy area, like equality issues, regeneration or research and data collection.

Description.Html: Human resources (HR) assistants provide admin support to the HR team in a company or organisation.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in human resources from the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become an HR officer or team leader.

Description.Html: Human resources (HR) managers develop, deliver and manage HR policies and plans.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers in HR through The Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could set up your own consultancy offering recruitment services, training, or advice on HR strategy and policy planning.

Description.Html: Human resources (HR) officers hire employees and help develop their careers, and look after employee relations, benefits and welfare.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in human resources from the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development and Personnel Today.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a member of CIPD to show your professional status and continue your professional development.

With experience, you could progress into senior management. You could also set up your own consultancy offering recruitment services or advice on policy planning.

Description.Html: Hydrologists study the impact of rainfall, rivers and waterways on the environment. They also look at sustainable ways to use water.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the British Hydrological Society or Chartered Institution of Water and Environmental Management for industry news, advice on professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can get information about hydrology, including work on water pollution, flooding and drought, from the Centre for Ecology & Hydrology.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about careers in hydrology from the British Hydrological Society and The Geological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior hydrologist, co-ordinating a team of researchers, hydrologists and engineers.

You might also work as a consultant, advising government departments and businesses on sustainable water use, civil hydro-engineering projects or flood risk management.

Description.Html: Hypnotherapists use hypnosis to help people make positive changes to their health, lifestyle and behaviour.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join an accredited register for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Most hypnotherapists are self-employed so it will help if you have some experience of running a business.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in hypnotherapy from the British Society of Clinical Hypnosis.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into teaching.

Description.Html: Illustrators produce drawings, paintings or diagrams for use in products like books and greetings cards, or on packaging.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
As a freelance illustrator you'll need to think of creative ways to get your work noticed. You'll also need a portfolio of your work to show prospective clients or for entry onto courses.

Building a website or starting a blog where you can showcase your work is one way to get noticed.

Having a presence on social media sites like Instagram is a great way of connecting with the public and potential customers.

If you work as a freelance illustrator you may decide to sell your work through an agent, who could put you in touch with more buyers. An agent will take a percentage of your sales as commission. The Society of Artists Agents has details of agents as well as examples of artists' work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in illustration from the Association of Illustrators and Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and graphic design skills you could work for a design agency, publishing company or magazine. You could also move into specialist work, for example architectural or archaeological illustration.

Description.Html: Image consultants advise individuals on their appearance and how to make an impact.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You should build up a portfolio that shows off your skills, for example makeover 'before and after' shots. You could also include client case studies that explain the impact of your advice and the difference it's made.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could work for a large, international agency, or specialise in a particular area of work.

Description.Html: Immigration advisers give advice on asylum claims, nationality, citizenship, deportation and employment, and represent clients in court.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Immigration Law Practitioners' Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to get into immigration advice work from the Immigration Law Practitioners' Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work on more complex and high-profile cases.

You could specialise in a particular area, like working with children, providing consular services or advising international students at a university.
